column4: OK, i've just installed the wonderful magicly awesome ubuntu, although i don't see how such a short name could actually mean `I am what I am because of who we all are' in `ancient African', but it's great nonetheless
but there's a snag, you see
i can't play my videos because i can't get w32codecs
i can't get them, so get them? that doesn't even make sense
you need to use the marillat repo, or get them by hand from mplayerhq.hu
have a ook at the wiki link
xvid is in the w32codecs pack?
debian makes it much easier to get patent encumbered packages then most other distributions i've tried, except suse and mandrake
might have been the old installer
i used RC1 and pre-RC2 installers, those are the newest ones (only ones, too)
it should remove toten-gstreamer but not ubuntu-desktop
i would imagine it's a philosophical 'avoid patented stuff' thing
well, you could be right, but in debian, they require things like patent-free | paten-encumbered sometimes, even if you have to add non-free repo in order to get it
hence my earlier statement that debian makes it easier than other distros
who would get sued? debian is a network of volunteers?
